title: H05-1095

sentences.text: This paper presents a phrase-based statistical machine translation method , based on non-contiguous phrases , i.e. phrases with gaps .
A method for producing such phrases from a word-aligned corpora is proposed .

A statistical translation model is also presented that deals such phrases , as well as a training method based on the maximization of translation accuracy , as measured with the NIST evaluation metric .
Translations are produced by means of a beam-search decoder .
Experimental results are presented , that demonstrate how the proposed method allows to better generalize from the training data .

summary: This paper presents a phrase-based statistical machine translation method , based on non-contiguous phrases , i.e. phrases with gaps . A method for producing such phrases from a word-aligned corpora is proposed . A statistical translation model is also presented that deals such phrases , as well as a training method based on the maximization of translation accuracy , as measured with the NIST evaluation metric . Translations are produced by means of a beam-search decoder . Experimental results are presented , that demonstrate how the proposed method allows to better generalize from the training data .

Predicate-based_on.label: based on
Predicate-based_on.description: The predicate 'based on' indicates a relationship where the subject (a concept or approach) relies on or draws inspiration from the object (another concept, method, or principle). This connection implies that the subject's characteristics, principles, or methodology are derived from or grounded in the object.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: To present means to introduce or offer something, typically an idea, concept, or methodology. In this sense, the predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject (a person, entity, or work) provides a new perspective, explanation, or approach to understand the object (an idea, method, or phenomenon).

Predicate-proposed.label: proposed
Predicate-proposed.description: The predicate 'proposed' indicates that an idea or plan has been put forward for consideration, discussion, or implementation. It suggests a sense of suggestion, recommendation, or introduction to a new concept, method, or approach.

Predicate-deals_with.label: deals with
Predicate-deals_with.description: The predicate 'deals with' indicates a relationship where the subject (a person, entity, or system) has some level of interaction, processing, handling, or management responsibility for the object. This can include tasks such as analyzing, interpreting, manipulating, organizing, or providing solutions related to the object.

Predicate-produced_by_means_of.label: produced by means of
Predicate-produced_by_means_of.description: The predicate 'produced by means of' indicates that the subject (in this case, Translations) was created or generated using the specified object (a beam-search decoder), implying a causal relationship between the two. It highlights the method or tool used to produce the subject.

Predicate-allows_to_better_generalize_fr.label: allows to better generalize from
Predicate-allows_to_better_generalize_fr.description: This predicate indicates that the subject enables or facilitates a process of generalization from the object. In other words, it suggests that the subject provides a means to derive more comprehensive and abstract concepts or patterns from the information contained within the object.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: The predicate 'is based on' indicates a relationship where the subject relies on or has its foundation in the object. It suggests that the subject's existence, validity, or functionality is grounded in or derived from the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subclass of a more general category or class represented by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject is a narrower term within the scope defined by the object.
